webvr a-frame app that simulates life in a typical house
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Certainly! Below is a simple WebVR A-Frame application that simulates life in a typical house. This example includes a living room, kitchen, and bedroom, and is designed to run entirely within a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JavaScript.

To use this code, simply copy it into a `.html` file and open it in a web browser that supports WebVR (or WebXR).

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>VR House Simulation</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
      body { margin: 0; }
      a-scene { height: 100vh; }
    </style>
  </head>
  <body>
    <a-scene>
      <!-- Sky -->
      <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

      <!-- Floor -->
      <a-plane rotation="-90 0 0" width="20" height="20" color="#7CFC00" position="0 0 0"></a-plane>

      <!-- Living Room -->
      <a-box position="-6 0.5 -3" color="#FFCC00" depth="1" height="1" width="3" rotation="0 45 0">
        <a-text value="Living Room" color="black" position="0 1.2 0"></a-text>
      </a-box>

      <!-- Kitchen -->
      <a-box position="6 0.5 -3" color="#FF5733" depth="1" height="1" width="3" rotation="0 -45 0">
        <a-text value="Kitchen" color="black" position="0 1.2 0"></a-text>
      </a-box>

      <!-- Bedroom -->
      <a-box position="0 0.5 3" color="#33CFF5" depth="1" height="1" width="3">
        <a-text value="Bedroom" color="black" position="0 1.2 0"></a-text>
      </a-box>

      <!-- Door to Living Room -->
      <a-gltf-model src="https://cdn.glitch.com/ca16cb2b-34c7-4424-b80f-71c4efaedcfc%2Fdoor.gltf?v=1628634179965"
                     scale="0.1 0.1 0.1" position="-6 0 -3.5" rotation="0 0 0"></a-gltf-model>

      <!-- Door to Kitchen -->
      <a-gltf-model src="https://cdn.glitch.com/ca16cb2b-34c7-4424-b80f-71c4efaedcfc%2Fdoor.gltf?v=1628634179965"
                     scale="0.1 0.1 0.1" position="6 0 -3.5" rotation="0 0 0"></a-gltf-model>

      <!-- Door to Bedroom -->
      <a-gltf-model src="https://cdn.glitch.com/ca16cb2b-34c7-4424-b80f-71c4efaedcfc%2Fdoor.gltf?v=1628634179965"
                     scale="0.1 0.1 0.1" position="0 0 3.5" rotation="0 0 0"></a-gltf-model>

      <!-- Camera -->
      <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>
  </body>
</html>
```

### Instructions for Use:
1. Copy the entire code and paste it into a new file named `index.html`.
2. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR or WebXR (like Chrome or Firefox with the necessary flags enabled).
3. Use the controls to navigate through the simple house setup!

### Notes:
- This is a minimalistic representation aimed at demonstrating how you can set up an A-Frame scene.
- The doors are linked to GLTF models for illustrative purposes. You might want to replace them with your own or adjust their paths.
- You can expand upon this code by adding more components, interactions, and features as needed.
